column4: Hi.  I accidentally filled up my harddrive when I was downloading some files unattended - now gdm won't let me log in and I can't seem to access those files to delete/move them with a LiveCD.  Does anyone have any ideas?
sudo rm -f  /path/tofiles
so no chance of backing them up?
I thought you wanted to revome them ?
where do you want to put them ?
I have another harddrive in my comp - it's the one I meant to download the files to.
can you mount both hdd ?
but at the moment I can't even *see* the files - I'm getting errors.  Which i probably should have said.
yes you should have
can you access the partition in question ?
yeah, the hdds are mounted, but the particular directory isn't accessible since it's under /home I'm guessing.
that shouldn' be an issie
what did you download with
They were torrented files.
do you know where yoru client stores partial torrent files ?
no, but I can check to see if I can figure it out.  brb.  (I was using ktorrent, if that helps.)
are they completely downloaded or partialy
I don't know where ktorrent stores it's partital but if you can figure that out you're half way there
I'm pretty sure that most of them were fully, even the last one - but the last one might have been partially.
can you try moving other files ? jsut to make somespace so you can boot back ?
it is totally working now.  Thank you for your help and patience.
no problem
